body: @SeeminglyScience Do you have access to an instance of Azure Virtual Desktop that can be used to reproduce this issue?
I do not :/ PowerShell is blocked entirely on mine.
Thank you @wdiggle  for submitting this issue. I haven't been able to repo this yet - our internal AVD is very restrictive.  Im in the process of accessing a full customer AVD to test this issue.

@wdiggle - I spoke with the AVD team, and following their testing suggestions, could not reproduce this error. My testing environment is not the same as the customers, and AVD recommends that customers experiencing this problem file an issue so they can attempt to repo. The AVD team has recommended that customers file an issue in Feedback Hub from the AVD host encountering the issue. Please select the category “Problem”, followed by “Apps” and “Remote Desktop”. Screenshot below. ￼

The key to testing is using the web client and not the AVD remote desktop client which works fine. Knowing the AVD team they will have tested using the remote desktop client app. For the moment we are finding that the preview installations work fine so will continue with that for now.

Thanks.

This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

@wdiggle This was already fixed in the 2.2 version of PSReadLine by https://github.com/PowerShell/PSReadLine/pull/2632. The v7.2.x of PowerShell ships the v2.1.0 PSReadLine which doesn't have that fix. Please upgrade to [v2.2.6](https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSReadLine/2.2.6) of PSReadLine. See https://github.com/PowerShell/psreadline#upgrading for instructions if you are not familiar with upgrading PSReadLine. For details about how the root cause is discovered, see the comment thread starting at https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17783#issuecomment-1211236702.
